result.execSummary:
The defendant Dorrin Donte Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court sentenced defendant to 3 days HOC with 3 days time served for a time served disposition.  Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges including DNA by 04-02-2015.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dorrin Donte Lewis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Check Packet
BAIL REFUND NOTICE MAILED TO SURETY.

Defendant Dorrin Donte Lewis in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), a class U misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 3 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 4/2/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Dorrin Donte Lewis in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  William Levins for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court approves the agreement.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and STAYS a judgment of conviction.  Review hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript (16 pages) commenced on 02-05-2014 PRELIMINARY HEARING / ARRAIGNMENT received and filed.

Defendant Dorrin Donte Lewis in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  William Berens, student intern under the supervision of Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #99CF2750 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Sergio Rentas-MPD Officer.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn. Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

$250.00 cash bail to be returned to the poster (remitter).  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription (no drugs).   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Dorrin Donte Lewis in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
